issue.title: PicklingError when using plugin installed via setup.py develop

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @xZise on Jul 10, 2016, 14:52

Using Flake8 3.0.0b2 I get a PicklingError when I try to it with a plugin ([flake8-string-format](https://github.com/xZise/flake8-string-format)) installed via `python setup.py develop`. When I use `pip install flake8-string-format` it won't cause the error. I tested it on Python version 2.7.10 and 3.5.2. Both show similar results:

```
$ flake8 flake8_string_format.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/queues.py", line 268, in _feed
    send(obj)
PicklingError: Can't pickle <type 'function'>: attribute lookup __builtin__.function failed
```

```
$ flake8 flake8_string_format.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/xzise/.pyenv/versions/3.5.1/lib/python3.5/multiprocessing/queues.py", line 241, in _feed
    obj = ForkingPickler.dumps(obj)
  File "/home/xzise/.pyenv/versions/3.5.1/lib/python3.5/multiprocessing/reduction.py", line 50, in dumps
    cls(buf, protocol).dump(obj)
AttributeError: Can't pickle local object 'compile.<locals>.marker_fn'
```

Uninstalling the plugin does not fix the error, but reinstalling `flake8` (obviously without the plugin). I'm also not sure what part of the plugin is actually causing that error. And maybe this is related to #164, but I'm not using `python setup.py flake8`.

To reproduce you can use the following commands:
```
$ cd …into a directory of your choosing…
$ wget https://github.com/xZise/flake8-string-format/archive/0.2.2.zip
$ unzip 0.2.2.zip 
$ cd flake8-string-format-0.2.2/
$ virtualenv failure
$ source failure/bin/activate
$ pip install flake8==3.0.0b2
$ python setup.py develop
$ flake8 flake8_string_format.py
```

issue.title: Flake8 3.0.1 doesn't work, throw _pickle.PicklingError and setup.py flake8 - hangs?

repository.name: flake8
repository.description: flake8 is a python tool that glues together pycodestyle, pyflakes, mccabe, and third-party plugins to check the style and quality of some python code.

issue.body:
In GitLab by @skirpichev on Jul 26, 2016, 01:13

```
$ python --version
Python 3.4.2
```

Flake8 installed with pip-8.1.2, setuptools-19.4.

Traceback:
```
$ python setup.py flake8
running flake8
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/python/3.4.2/lib/python3.4/multiprocessing/queues.py", line 242, in _feed
    obj = ForkingPickler.dumps(obj)
  File "/opt/python/3.4.2/lib/python3.4/multiprocessing/reduction.py", line 50, in dumps
    cls(buf, protocol).dump(obj)
_pickle.PicklingError: Can't pickle <function compile.<locals>.marker_fn at 0x7fc481fe98c8>: attribute lookup marker_fn on _markerlib.markers failed
```

Travis job was killed by 10 min time limit for a command.  Full travis log:
https://api.travis-ci.org/jobs/147168228/log.txt?deansi=true

If I turn off this limit with travis_wait - travis job killed by 20min time limit:
https://s3.amazonaws.com/archive.travis-ci.org/jobs/147377230/log.txt 
```
$ travis_wait python setup.py flake8
Still running (1 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (2 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (3 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (4 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (5 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (6 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (7 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (8 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (9 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (10 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (11 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (12 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (13 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (14 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (15 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (16 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (17 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (18 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (19 of 20): python setup.py flake8
Still running (20 of 20): python setup.py flake8
[31;1mTimeout (20 minutes) reached. Terminating "python setup.py flake8"[0m
[31;1mThe command python setup.py flake8 exited with 137.[0m
[32;1mLog:[0m
running flake8
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/python/3.4.2/lib/python3.4/multiprocessing/queues.py", line 242, in _feed
    obj = ForkingPickler.dumps(obj)
  File "/opt/python/3.4.2/lib/python3.4/multiprocessing/reduction.py", line 50, in dumps
    cls(buf, protocol).dump(obj)
_pickle.PicklingError: Can't pickle <function compile.<locals>.marker_fn at 0x7fd83e6b98c8>: attribute lookup marker_fn on _markerlib.markers failed
travis_time:end:1cba09f7:start=1469512164241516658,finish=1469513364289329319,duration=1200047812661
[0K
[31;1mThe command "travis_wait python setup.py flake8" exited with 137.[0m
travis_time:start:274feb42
```

If flake8 now is just so slow by default - it's  a very severe bug too, imho.
